H0.text: In a film who married Princess Fiona, the daughter of King Harold and Queen Lillian of Far, Far Away. Prince Charming

H1.text: In a film who married Princess Fiona, the daughter of King Harold and Queen Lillian of Far, Far Away. Lord Farquaad

H2.text: In a film who married Princess Fiona, the daughter of King Harold and Queen Lillian of Far, Far Away. King Arthur

H3.text: In a film who married Princess Fiona, the daughter of King Harold and Queen Lillian of Far, Far Away. שרעק

A4.text: They marry in the swamp with the fairy tale creatures in attendance

A5.text: Shrek stops her wedding with Farquaad and marries her himself.

A7.text: the dragon that had once imprisoned Fiona, eats Farquaad, killing him.

A8.text: Shrek finally confesses her feelings for Shrek and, upon kissing him, turns into an ogre full-time; the two ogres marry.

A9.text: Shrek fails to prevent Charming from kissing Fiona, but instead of falling in love, Fiona knocks him out.

A10.text: Princess Fiona is Shrek's wife from the end of the first film on.

A11.text: Arthur Pendragon is a cousin of Fiona.

A12.text: The characters have no relation to those who appear in the Shrek films.

A13.text: Prince Charming is the son of the Fairy Godmother, who pretends to be Shrek in an effort to win Fiona's heart and marry her.
